org.qbroker.event

Interface EventEscalation

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    EventEscalator, EventTracker

    public interface EventEscalation
    EventEscalation is an interface for an escalation upon an event.

    It is up to the implementation to decide whether to support checkpointing and how to do checkpointing.
    Author:
    yannanlu@yahoo.com

    • Method Detail

      • escalate

        Event escalate(int status,
               long currentTime,
               Event event)
        It examines the event and returns a new event as the escalation or null if no escalation.

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        returns the name of the escalation

      • getEscalationOrder

        int getEscalationOrder()
        It returns an integer as the escalation order that determines if the escalation event to be processed before the original event or not. If the escalation order is ORDER_FISRT, the escalation event should be processed before the original event. If it is ORDER_LAST, the escalation event should be processed after. If it is ORDER_NONE, which one is the first does not matter.

      • resetSession

        int resetSession(long currentTime)
        resets the internal session returns number of items being reset

      • getSessionTime

        long getSessionTime()
        returns the start time of current session

      • getSessionSize

        int getSessionSize()
        returns the size of current session

      • checkpoint

      • restoreFromCheckpoint

        void restoreFromCheckpoint(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> checkpointer)

      • clear

        void clear()
        cleans up all internal caches and releases all resources
